guideline_id: 2024CSCO肿瘤治疗所致血小板减少症诊疗指南-  .txt

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Emergency situation with platelet count <10×10⁹/L or active bleeding

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Platelet transfusion plus rhTPO or rhIL-11
rhTPO (300 U/kg daily) or rhIL-11 (25-50 μg/kg daily)
Combine with TPO receptor agonists (e.g., hetrombopag, avatrombopag)
rhTPO or rhIL-11 with or without TPO receptor agonists

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Patients undergoing concurrent chemoradiotherapy with radiation to long bones or pelvis
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Prophylactic use of rhTPO or rhIL-11

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Patients with platelet reduction due to PARP inhibitors or T-DM1
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Pause targeted therapy and administer rhTPO or rhIL-11

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Immunotherapy patients after excluding immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) or thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP)
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: rhTPO or rhIL-11; for severe cases, add immunoglobulin or corticosteroids

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Secondary prevention for patients with platelet nadir <50×10⁹/L or 50-75×10⁹/L with high bleeding risk
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: rhTPO: 300 U/kg every other day starting 1-2 days after chemotherapy for 7-10 days

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Secondary prevention for patients with platelet nadir <50×10⁹/L or 50-75×10⁹/L with high bleeding risk
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Hetrombopag 75 mg daily orally until next chemotherapy cycle
TPO level testing may guide medication but is not routinely recommended; genetic polymorphisms require further research

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: May guide use of rhTPO in patients with low endogenous TPO levels
Not routinely recommended; polymorphisms in drug metabolism genes (e.g., for oxaliplatin) may influence risk but require further study

biomarker_clinical_significance.clinical_significance: TPO levels may guide the use of recombinant thrombopoietin (rhTPO) but are not routinely recommended. Genetic polymorphisms in drug metabolism genes could influence the risk of chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia but require further research.
